com.stoyanr.mastermind

Class AbstractAlgorithm

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.stoyanr.mastermind.AbstractAlgorithm
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    Algorithm
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    ExpectedSizeAlgorithm, KnuthAlgorithm, PharaoxAlgorithm, SimpleAlgorithm

    public abstract class AbstractAlgorithm
extends Object
implements Algorithm
    An abstract Algorithm implementation to be extended by the concrete strategies. It does the following to make the next guess:
    • Based on the guesses and their scores so far, evaluate the set of all possible codes that could be a solution.
    • If this set is non-empty, take its first member, assign it a rating of 0, and promote it as our best guess so far.
    • Iterate through the set of all codes of the given game setup, and for each member calculate a rating. Note that here we iterate through all codes, not just all possible codes, since the best guess for a given algorithm could also be impossible. Compare this calculated rating to the best rating we have so far, and promote it as the best rating if it's higher, or if it's equal and the current code is possible, while the current best guess is not possible.

    This class has a single protected abstract method calculateGuessRating(String). All concrete strategies extending this class should implement only this single method, as they differ only in the way they rate the guesses.

    This is the Template Method design pattern in action.

    Author:
    Stoyan Rachev

    • Method Detail

      • getAllPossibleScores

        protected final List<Score> getAllPossibleScores()
        Returns all possible scores for the current game setup. This method simply delegates to Mastermind.getAllPossibleScores().
        Returns:
        All possible scores for the current game setup.

      • getPossibleCodes

        public final SortedSet<String> getPossibleCodes()
        Returns all codes that are still possible (could be a solution), taking into account the scores assigned to all previously made guesses.
        Returns:
        All codes that are still possible.

      • makeGuess

        public final String makeGuess()
        Description copied from interface: Algorithm
        Makes a next guess based on the implemented strategy. Should take into account the scores assigned to all previously made guesses.
        Specified by:
        makeGuess in interface Algorithm
        Returns:
        The guess made by the algorithm.

      • evaluatePossibleCodes

        protected final SortedSet<String> evaluatePossibleCodes(String guess,
                                      Score score)
        Determines all codes from the still possible codes against which the passed guess evaluates as the passed score. This method simply delegates to Mastermind.evaluatePossibleCodes(String, Score, SortedSet).
        Parameters:
        guess - The guess to be checked.
        score - The score that we are aiming at.
        Returns:
        All codes which satisfy the above conditions, sorted alphabetically.

      • calculateGuessRating

        protected abstract double calculateGuessRating(String guess)
        Calculates a rating for the passed guess. The calculated rating should be a double value greater or equal to 0. Usually, the guess with the highest rating is the guess eventually returned by makeGuess().
        Parameters:
        guess - The guess for which a rating should be calculated.
        Returns:
        The rating calculated for the passed guess.

      • putGuessScore

        public final void putGuessScore(String guess,
                 Score score)
        Description copied from interface: Algorithm
        Accepts a score for the last guess returned by Algorithm.makeGuess().
        Specified by:
        putGuessScore in interface Algorithm
        Parameters:
        guess - The guess which is rated with the passed score. Normally, this should be the last guess returned by Algorithm.makeGuess().
        score - The score assigned to the passed guess.
